Somedays The World Blackens

04 Aug 2018

Somedays…

Somedays, the problem is, that it feels like the sun will never rise,
It departs with the demise of all your avenues, hacked off, one rotten limb at a time,
Something wild, and violent caged within, starts to snarl, gnawing and growing off emotion akin to blood-sucking lice,
This white blazing anger though, gasps, dims and darkens in the end, into nothing but a doom of frozen shine.

Somedays, you raise the pyres of your ashen hopes, again and again against the night,
To find it discovered with vicious glee, strangled by the looming void, an innocent choked out.
Still you will prevail, atleast the pure strength of your heart will be your true sight!
Only to hear the laughter of the never-ending night, the summoned willpower blinded, fleeing in a mad rout.

Somedays…
will be these days.
Where the appeal of a silent tomb,
of a world consumed to nothigness, can be deafening
For the good men, these false days will pass, they say.
But what about those, whose eyes can never feel the light again?
